thread.section_title: The Union Democrat, Sonora, CA News, Sports, & Weather
thread.title: News of Record for Oct. 17, 2015

title: News of Record for Oct. 17, 2015
text: News of Record for Oct. 17, 2015 News of Record for Oct. 17, 2015 By Union Democrat staff October 17, 2015 10:16 am TUOLUMNE COUNTY The Sonora Police Department reported the following: THURSDAY 4:26 p.m., vandalism — The gas line to a dump truck was cut on Mill Villa Court. 7:05 p.m., hazardous situation — A woman wearing a cat costume hitchhiked in the middle of Morning Star Drive. 7:46 p.m., theft — A gaming console and car keys were stolen on South Shepherd Street. The Sheriff’s Office reported the following: THURSDAY 12:44 p.m., Sonora area — A man walked along Mono Way carrying his laundry and a bow and arrow. 3:09 a.m., Twain Harte — Yelling and screaming was heard on Robin Hood Drive. 6:05 a.m., Jamestown — A “crazy” woman yelled and screamed on the corner of Seco Street. 7:07 a.m., Sonora area — River rafts, clothing, jewelry, two light-blue totes and two big gray suitcases were stolen from the top of a burgundy vehicle parked on Chukar Circle. 9:51 a.m., Jamestown — A Jacksonville Road resident possibly grew marijuana in the area. 10:59 a.m., Sonora area — A West Blue Bell Road woman believed her neighbor was growing marijuana on their property because she could “smell it once every three months.” 11:49 a.m., Jamestown — A man and a woman bothered customers by asking for money in front of a Highway 108 business. 12:23 p.m., Sonora area — A Feather River Drive woman was harassed over the telephone. 1:01 p.m., Soulsbyville — Two dirt bikes were stolen from a Willow Springs Drive storage unit. 4:06 p.m., Sonora area — A Jamestown Road residence was burglarized. 4:54 p.m., Jamestown — A Preston Lane person claimed they found “a nickel that changes on the face in the light or under shadow.” The person said they saw on television that there is a $5 million dollar reward for this nickel, and wants to return it to its owner. 6:43 p.m., Sonora area — People rode ATVs for hours in front of a Tuolumne Road business, the caller stated they “want something done about this noise now.” 7 p.m., Jamestown — A man who was swerving along Highway 108 was pulled over, and when asked if he had been drinking stated, “I had a couple with dinner.” 10:14 p.m., Tuolumne — A man on Tuolumne Road yelled and screamed. Felony bookings THURSDAY 10:10 p.m., Sonora — Nicole Marie Cash, 28, of the 16600 block of Allison Way, Sonora, was booked on suspicion of unlawful use of personal identifying information, and misdemeanor possession of a controlled substance, possession of controlled substance paraphernalia and possession of marijuana or hashish after an arrest on Mono Way. Arrests Cited on suspicion of driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs: THURSDAY 12:13 p.m., Sonora — Darrell James Leamon, 60, of the 18000 block of Golden Oaks Drive, Jamestown, was booked after an arrest on Mono Way. 7:44 p.m., Sonora — Kenneth Michael Howard, 62, of the 9000 block of Friendship Hill Road, Jamestown, was booked after an arrest on Highway 49. CALAVERAS COUNTY The Sheriff’s Office reported the following: THURSDAY 8 a.m., San Andreas — A man who was smoking sat on a counter with his pants down to his knees on Russell Road. 9:19 a.m., West Point — A Bald Mountain Road man hired another man off of a website to complete some work, but is now concerned that he is possibly stalking his wife and causing problems. 2:39 p.m., West Point — A person was possibly “squatting” inside an Acorn Way home. Felony bookings THURSDAY 12:07 a.m., Angels Camp — Brian Thomas Deangelis, 25, of the first block of North Benham Road, Seymour, Connecticut, was booked on suspicion of being a felon in possession of a firearm, and misdemeanor possession of narcotic controlled substances and possession of controlled substance paraphernalia after an arrest on South Main Street. 12:15 p.m., Angels Camp — Michael Dennis Airola, 67, of the 300 block of North Baker Street, was booked on suspicion of possession of marijuana for sale after an arrest on Appaloosa Road. 12:15 p.m., Angels Camp — Edmond Anthony Santos Jr., 40, of the 600 block of Copello Drive, Angels Camp, was booked on suspicion of manufacturing or possessing any leaded cane, or any instrument or weapon of the kind, being a felon in possession of a firearm, having a concealed weapon within a vehicle, carrying a loaded stolen firearm, being a criminal carrying a loaded firearm, participating in a criminal street gang, owning ammo when prohibited, and misdemeanors being under the influence of a controlled substance and being an addict driving a vehicle after an arrest on Appaloosa Road. 2:30 p.m., Copperopolis — Lucas Edward Statzer, 27, of the 200 block of Orchard Avenue, Modesto, was booked on suspicion of being a felon in possession of a firearm and misdemeanor driving with a suspended license after an arrest on Highway 4. 10:15 p.m., Murphys — Frank Dallin Kohout, 20, of the 500 block of Williams Street, was booked on suspicion of threatening with intent to terrorize, and misdemeanor disorderly conduct with alcohol, and obstructing or resisting a public peace officer after an arrest on Williams Street. Arrests Cited on suspicion of driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs: THURSDAY
